name: git-guardian
label: GitGuardian
description: GitGuardian is a cybersecurity platform that specializes in detecting and preventing the exposure of sensitive information in source code repositories, specifically Git repositories. It is designed to help organizations and developers protect their code and prevent the accidental or unauthorized exposure of credentials, API keys, tokens, and other sensitive data that may be present in code repositories.

fields.name: api_key
fields.title: API Key
fields.tooltip: Specify the API Key that you have generated on the GitGuardian portal. Your API key can be created and revoked from the API section of your dashboard on GitGuardian.
fields.description: Specify the API Key which you have generated in GitGuardian. Your API key can be created and revoked from the API section of your dashboard on GitGuardian.

fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get Secret Incidents List
operations.description: Lists secret incidents detected by the GitGuardian dashboard based on the date range, status, severity, and other filter criteria that you have specified. Occurrences are not returned in this route.
operations.tooltip: Lists secret incidents detected by the GitGuardian dashboard based on the date range, status, severity, and other filter criteria that you have specified. Occurrences are not returned in this route.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.title: Number of Incidents Per Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of items to list per page. By default, number of items per page is 20.
parameters.description: Specify the number of items to list per page. By default, number of items per page is 20.

parameters.name: date_after
parameters.title: Incidents After the Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start of the date range after which the incidents are to be listed. Date format should be in ISO 8601 Format Ex - 2023-07-03T06:45:30.011936Z
parameters.description: Specify the start of the date range after which the incidents are to be listed. Date format should be in ISO 8601 Format Ex - 2023-07-03T06:45:30.011936Z

parameters.name: date_before
parameters.title: Incidents Before the Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end of the date range before which the incidents are to be listed. Date format should be in ISO 8601 Format Ex - 2023-07-03T06:45:30.011936Z
parameters.description: Specify the end of the date range before which the incidents are to be listed. Date format should be in ISO 8601 Format Ex - 2023-07-03T06:45:30.011936Z

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Filter Incidents with the following status. You can Select the following options (Ignored, Triggered, Assigned, Resolved)
parameters.description: Filter Incidents with the following status. You can Select the following options (Ignored, Triggered, Assigned, Resolved)

parameters.name: severity
parameters.title: Severity
parameters.tooltip: Specify the severity to filter Incidents. You can Use following options (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Info, Unknown).
parameters.description: Specify the severity to filter Incidents. You can Use following options (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Info, Unknown).

parameters.name: validity
parameters.title: Validity
parameters.tooltip: Select the validity to filter incidents.. You can choose from (Valid, Invalid, Failed to Check, No Checker, Unknown)
parameters.description: Select the validity to filter incidents.. You can choose from (Valid, Invalid, Failed to Check, No Checker, Unknown)

parameters.name: tags
parameters.title: Tags
parameters.tooltip: Select the tags to filter incidents. Use None if you want to filter incidents with no tags.You can select multiple tags from following options: Select one or more options, From Historical Scan, Ignored in Check Run, Public,Default Branch ,Regression, Sensitive File, Test File ,No Tags.
parameters.description: Select the tags to filter incidents. Use None if you want to filter incidents with no tags.You can select multiple tags from following options: Select one or more options, From Historical Scan, Ignored in Check Run, Public,Default Branch ,Regression, Sensitive File, Test File ,No Tags.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.title: Ordering
parameters.tooltip: Sort the results by their field value.
parameters.description: Sort the results by their field value.

parameters.name: assignee_email
parameters.title: Assignee Email
parameters.tooltip: Specify the email address of the assignee to filter the secret incidents list.
parameters.description: Specify the email address of the assignee to filter the secret incidents list.

parameters.name: assignee_id
parameters.title: Assignee ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the member ID of the assignee to filter the secret incidents list. You can get the Member ID of the user from Get Members List action.
parameters.description: Specify the member ID of the assignee to filter the secret incidents list. You can get the Member ID of the user from Get Members List action.

parameters.name: detector_group_name
parameters.title: Detector Group Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the group name of the detector to filter the secret incidents list.
parameters.description: Specify the group name of the detector to filter the secret incidents list.

parameters.name: ignorer_id
parameters.title: Ignorer ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the user ID of assignee whose secret incidents are to be ignored and hence not listed.You can get the Member ID of the user from Get Members List action.
parameters.description: Specify the user ID of assignee whose secret incidents are to be ignored and hence not listed.You can get the Member ID of the user from Get Members List action.

parameters.name: resolver_id
parameters.title: Resolver ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the resolver by which incidents with the specified Resolver ID are to be listed. You can get the Member ID of the user from Get Members List action.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the resolver by which incidents with the specified Resolver ID are to be listed. You can get the Member ID of the user from Get Members List action.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.tooltip: Specify the pagination cursor token for listing the next or previous page. Next and previous cursors are shown only when the list spans multiple pages and has a next or a previous page.
parameters.description: Specify the pagination cursor token for listing the next or previous page. Next and previous cursors are shown only when the list spans multiple pages and has a next or a previous page.

operations.title: Get Secret Incident Details
operations.description: Retrieves secret incident details as detected by the GitGuardian dashboard with its occurrences based on the incident ID and the number of occurrences that you have specified.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident whose Details are to be retrieved.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose Details are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: with_occurrences
parameters.title: Number of Occurrences
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of occurrences of this incident to retrieve. Default value of Number of Occurrences is 20.
parameters.description: Specify the number of occurrences of this incident to retrieve. Default value of Number of Occurrences is 20.

operations.title: Update Secret Incident
operations.description: Updates a secret incident's severity based on the incident ID and the severity that you have specified.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident which is to be updated.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident which is to be updated.

parameters.name: severity
parameters.title: Severity
parameters.tooltip: Select the severity to update. You can Use following options (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Info, Unknown).
parameters.description: Select the severity to update. You can Use following options (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Info, Unknown).

operations.title: Assign Secret Incident
operations.description: Assigns a secret incident detected by the GitGuardian dashboard to a workspace member based on the incident ID, email address, and member ID that you have specified.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the incident ID to be assigned.
parameters.description: Specify the incident ID to be assigned.

parameters.name: email
parameters.title: Email
parameters.tooltip: Specify the email address of the member to be assigned to this incident. This parameter is mutually exclusive with Member ID
parameters.description: Specify the email address of the member to be assigned to this incident. This parameter is mutually exclusive with Member ID

parameters.name: member_id
parameters.title: Member ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the member to be assigned to this incident. This parameter is mutually exclusive with Email
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the member to be assigned to this incident. This parameter is mutually exclusive with Email

operations.title: Unassign Secret Incident
operations.description: Unassigns a secret incident based on the incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the incident ID whose assignee is to be removed.
parameters.description: Specify the incident ID whose assignee is to be removed.

operations.title: Resolve Secret Incident
operations.description: Resolves and Revokes (If Given) a secret incident detected by the GitGuardian dashboard based on the incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.name: secret_revoked
parameters.title: Secret Revoked
parameters.tooltip: Select the checkbox to revoke the secret related to the incident.
parameters.description: Select the checkbox to revoke the secret related to the incident.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify The ID of the incident to retrieve and mark as resolved.
parameters.description: Specify The ID of the incident to retrieve and mark as resolved.

operations.title: Scan Documents Content
operations.description: Scans provided document content for policy breaks based on the document attachment type and its reference ID that you have specified.

parameters.name: input
parameters.title: Type
parameters.tooltip: Select a method of file submission to GitGuardian for analysis. You can select from following options: (Attachment ID, File IRI)
parameters.description: Select a method of file submission to GitGuardian for analysis. You can select from following options: (Attachment ID, File IRI)

parameters.name: value
parameters.title: Reference ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify a reference ID to access the attachment metadata from FortiSOAR™'s Attachments module. If you have selected Attachment ID, this defaults to the {{vars.attachment_id}} value. If you have selected File IRI, then this defaults to the {{vars.file_iri}} value.
parameters.description: Specify a reference ID to access the attachment metadata from FortiSOAR™'s Attachments module. If you have selected Attachment ID, this defaults to the {{vars.attachment_id}} value. If you have selected File IRI, then this defaults to the {{vars.file_iri}} value.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.title: Filename
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Filename of the attachment along with its extension.
parameters.description: Specify the Filename of the attachment along with its extension.

operations.title: Get Secret Occurrences List
operations.description: Lists occurrences of secrets in the monitored perimeter based on the date range, occurrence count, source name and other filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.title: Number of Occurrences per page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of Occurrences to list per page. By default, number of items per page is 20.
parameters.description: Specify the number of Occurrences to list per page. By default, number of items per page is 20.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.title: Source ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the source ID to filter the secret occurrences with the same source ID. You can get the Source ID from the Action LIST SOURCES.
parameters.description: Specify the source ID to filter the secret occurrences with the same source ID. You can get the Source ID from the Action LIST SOURCES.

parameters.name: source_name
parameters.title: Source Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the source name to filter the secret occurrences with the same source name.
parameters.description: Specify the source name to filter the secret occurrences with the same source name.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the incident ID to filter the list of secret occurrences retrieved.
parameters.description: Specify the incident ID to filter the list of secret occurrences retrieved.

parameters.name: date_after
parameters.title: Occurrences After Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start of the date range after which the incidents are to be listed. Date format should be in ISO 8601 Format Ex - 2023-07-03T06:45:30.011936Z
parameters.description: Specify the After Date by which Entries found after this date will be shown. Date format should be in ISO 8601 Format Ex - 2023-07-03T06:45:30.011936Z

parameters.name: date_before
parameters.title: Occurrences Before Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end of the date range before which the incidents are to be listed. Date format should be in ISO 8601 Format Ex - 2023-07-03T06:45:30.011936Z
parameters.description: Specify the end of the date range before which the incidents are to be listed. Date format should be in ISO 8601 Format Ex - 2023-07-03T06:45:30.011936Z

parameters.name: presence
parameters.title: Presence
parameters.tooltip: Specify if the secret occurrences are present or removed.
parameters.description: Specify if the secret occurrences are present or removed.

parameters.name: author_name
parameters.title: Author Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the author name to filter the occurrences related to the specified name. You must specify a minimum of 3 characters.
parameters.description: Specify the author name to filter the occurrences related to the specified name. You must specify a minimum of 3 characters.

parameters.name: author_info
parameters.title: Author Info
parameters.tooltip: Specify the author email address to filter the occurrences related to the specified email. You must specify a minimum of 3 characters.
parameters.description: Specify the author email address to filter the occurrences related to the specified email. You must specify a minimum of 3 characters.

parameters.name: sha
parameters.title: Sha
parameters.tooltip: Specify the commit SHA to search in the retrieved occurrences.
parameters.description: Specify the commit SHA to search in the retrieved occurrences.

parameters.name: filepath
parameters.title: Filepath
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filepath to search in the retrieved occurrences.
parameters.description: Specify the filepath to search in the retrieved occurrences.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.title: Ordering
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sort criteria to order of the results. The default sort order is ascending (ASC). To sort in descending order precede the criteria by a -
parameters.description: Specify the sort criteria to order of the results. The default sort order is ascending (ASC). To sort in descending order precede the criteria by a -

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.tooltip: Specify the pagination cursor token for listing the next or previous page. Next and previous cursors are shown only when the list spans multiple pages and has a next or a previous page.
parameters.description: Specify the pagination cursor token for listing the next or previous page. Next and previous cursors are shown only when the list spans multiple pages and has a next or a previous page.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.title: Tags
parameters.tooltip: Select the tags to filter Occurrences. Use None if you want to filter Occurrence of incidents with no tags.You can select multiple tags from following options: Select one or more options, From Historical Scan, Ignored in Check Run,Default Branch,Public, Regression, Sensitive File, Test File ,No Tags.
parameters.description: Select the tags to filter Occurrences. Use None if you want to filter Occurrence of incidents with no tags.You can select multiple tags from following options: Select one or more options, From Historical Scan, Ignored in Check Run,Default Branch,Public, Regression, Sensitive File, Test File ,No Tags.

operations.title: Get Members List
operations.description: List Details such as Member Id, Name, Email about workspace Members.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.title: Number of Members per page
parameters.tooltip: Number of Members to list per page. By Default, This parameters value is 20.
parameters.description: Number of Members to list per page. By Default, This parameters value is 20.

parameters.name: role
parameters.title: Role
parameters.tooltip: Filter members based on their role.
parameters.description: Filter members based on their role.

parameters.name: search
parameters.title: Search
parameters.tooltip: Search members based on their name or email.
parameters.description: Search members based on their name or email.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.title: Ordering
parameters.tooltip: Sort the results by their field value. The default sort is ASC, DESC if the field is preceded by a '-'.
parameters.description: Sort the results by their field value. The default sort is ASC, DESC if the field is preceded by a '-'.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.tooltip: Specify the pagination cursor token for listing the next or previous page. Next and previous cursors are shown only when the list spans multiple pages and has a next or a previous page.
parameters.description: Specify the pagination cursor token for listing the next or previous page. Next and previous cursors are shown only when the list spans multiple pages and has a next or a previous page.

operations.title: Get Sources List
operations.description: List VCS (Github Repositories) sources monitored by GitGuardian.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.title: Per Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of items to list per page. By default, number of items per page is 20.
parameters.description: Specify the number of items to list per page. By default, number of items per page is 20.

parameters.name: search
parameters.title: Search
parameters.tooltip: Filter Sources matching this string.
parameters.description: Filter Sources matching this string.

parameters.name: last_scan_status
parameters.title: Last Scan Status
parameters.tooltip: Filter sources based on the status of their latest historical scan.
parameters.description: Filter sources based on the status of their latest historical scan.

parameters.name: health
parameters.title: Health
parameters.tooltip: Filter sources based on their health status.
parameters.description: Filter sources based on their health status.

parameters.name: type
parameters.title: Type
parameters.tooltip: Filter Sources by integration type.
parameters.description: Filter Sources by integration type.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.title: Ordering
parameters.tooltip: Sort the results by their field value. The default sort is ASC, DESC if the field is preceded by a '-'.
parameters.description: Sort the results by their field value. The default sort is ASC, DESC if the field is preceded by a '-'.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.title: Visibility
parameters.tooltip: Filter Sources by visibility status.
parameters.description: Filter Sources by visibility status.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.tooltip: Specify the pagination cursor token for listing the next or previous page. Next and previous cursors are shown only when the list spans multiple pages and has a next or a previous page.
parameters.description: Specify the pagination cursor token for listing the next or previous page. Next and previous cursors are shown only when the list spans multiple pages and has a next or a previous page.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.title: External ID
parameters.tooltip: Filter Sources by specified external ID.
parameters.description: Filter Sources by specified external ID.
